info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun and west central Oconee Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Clayton, or 6 miles west of Oconee State Park, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oconee State Park, Mountain Rest, Long Creek and Pine Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
